Judul: ACTIVITY OF AQUEOUS EXTRACT OF CARICA PAPAYA L. LEAVES, CENTELLA ASIATICA LEAVES AND ITS COMBINATION ON WHITE BLOOD CELL AND PLATELET LEVEL OF FEMALE SWISS WEBSTER MICE
Abstrak:
Background and purpose : Dengue fever is characterized by a decreased level of
platelet in the blood. Carica papaya L. and Centella asiatica have been used
empirically to cure dengue fever. Aim : The aim of this study was to examine the
activity of aqueous extract of Carica papaya L. leaves, Centella asiatica leaves
and its combination on the blood platelet level of female Swiss Webster mice.
Method : Mice were divided into 7 groups consists of one group for negative
control, and the remaining groups being administered orally with various extract
concentration of Carica papaya L., Centella asiatica and its combination for 3
days consecutively. Platelets were count using a Hematology Analyzer. Results :
The combination of the extracts which showed a positive effect on the platelet
increment were the combination of high dose of Carica papaya L. - high dose of
Centella asiatica and a positive effect on the increase of white blood cell count.
High dose of Carica papaya L. (50mg/20g) showed a steady increase in the
platelet count, and showed significant difference compared to the negative
control, whereas Centella asiatica did not have an effect on the platelet activity of
the mice. Conclusion : Aqueous extract of Carica papaya L. leaves at dose of
50mg/20g mouse bw has the highest platelet increment, suggesting that the extract
probably can be used as an alternative treatment for dengue fever.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Dr. Neng Fisheri Kurniati, S.Si., M.Si., Apt.
Kata Kunci: Dengue fever, thrombocytopenia, Carica papaya L., Centella asiatica, hematology analyzer.
